description: Terry v. Ohio - stop and frisk based on reasonable suspicion
facts: Officer observed Terry and others acting suspiciously
Men repeatedly walked by store window peering inside
Officer conducted pat-down search for weapons
Gun was discovered during the frisk
asp_facts: case(terry). amendment(terry, fourth). police_action(terry, stop_and_frisk). reasonable_suspicion(terry, yes). probable_cause(terry, no). suspicious_behavior_observed(terry, yes). weapon_found(terry, yes). officer_safety_concern(terry, yes). warrant_obtained(terry, no).
question: Can police conduct a stop and frisk based on reasonable suspicion without probable cause or a warrant?
rationale: When an officer observes unusual conduct leading to a reasonable suspicion that criminal activity may be afoot and that persons may be armed and dangerous, the officer may conduct a limited search for weapons for self-protection. This Terry stop requires only reasonable suspicion, not probable cause.
